body_html:
Yes, create a virutalenv, then switch to that virtualenv ("activate" that virtualenv) and pip-install tensorflow into that virtualenv.

From a directory that is not in the tensorflow source tree and while still in the virtualenv, run the example Python script.
body_text:
Yes, create a virutalenv, then switch to that virtualenv ("activate" that virtualenv) and pip-install tensorflow into that virtualenv.
From a directory that is not in the tensorflow source tree and while still in the virtualenv, run the example Python script.
body:
Yes, create a virutalenv, then switch to that virtualenv ("activate" that virtualenv) and [pip-install tensorflow into that virtualenv.](https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_linux#installing_with_virtualenv)

From a directory **that is not in the tensorflow source tree** and while still in the virtualenv, run the example Python script.
